info.name: Hippocampus, fimbria
info.description: The fimbria is a band of white matter along the medial edge of the hippocampus.  It consists of the myelinated axons that formed the alveus on the ventricular surface of the hippocampus.  Near the splenium of the corpus callosum, the fimbria separate from the hippocampus and become the crus of the fornix.
